angrycockatoogirl 158467333692 "2017-03-16 07:29:09 GMT" http://angrycockatoogirl.tumblr.com/post/158467333692/jadenvargen-if-your-first-reaction-as-an-adult "jadenvargen:  if your first reaction as an adult in fandom when called out is to cry about how “these kids are so whiny” “in MY day people didn’t care” or “I’M not responsible for a safe space”
column2: then i’m honestly just dissapointed and embarrassed by you. if you as an adult
column3: consciously choose to share space with minors-which
column5: by being on a public forum like this and interacting constantly with them- you’re responsible for creating a suitable and non-threatning enviroment for them
column6: and not whine and cry whenever minors say something you contribute to is making them uncomfortable- because they have the right to be upset.  you
column7: as an adult are the responsible one in this situation
column8: whether you’re mature enough to accept this or not. fan forum is not a magical place where age barriers dissapear
column9: you’re very much the adult one and the fact that some adults will bully minors on this hellscape because “they want to make this a safespace :(” is disgusting and dissapointing to say the least. grow up and take responsibility.  " False text

column2: some angsty prompts As a hello With a hoarse voice
column3: under the blankets A scream Over a cup of tea Over a beer bottle On a sunny Tuesday afternoon
column4: the late sunlight glowing in your hair As a thank you As an apology When baking chocolate chip cookies Not said to me With a shuddering gasp When we lay together on the fresh spring grass In a letter A whisper in the ear Loud
column5: so everyone can hear Over and over again
column6: till it’s nothing but a senseless babble When the broken grass litters the floor  From very far away With no space left between us As we huddle together
column7: the storm raging outside Over your shoulder Muffled
column8: from the other side of the door Through a song Without really meaning it In a blissful sigh as you fall asleep Broken
column9: as you clutch the sleeve of my jacket and beg me not to leave A taunt
column10: with one eyebrow raised and a grin bubbling at your lips Slowly
column11: the words dripping from your tongue like honey Too quick
column12: mumbled into your scarf In awe
column13: the first time you realised it In a way I can’t return On a post-it note  " False text
